meanings.definition: A sugar composed of two monosaccharides.
meanings.sent1: I learned that a disaccharide is a sweet substance made from two simple sugars.
meanings.sent2: My favorite disaccharide is sucrose, which is found in sugar cane and sugar beets.
meanings.sent3: Why did the disaccharide break up with the monosaccharide? They just couldn't bond anymore!
meanings.sent4: The disaccharide acted like a bridge between the two monosaccharides, connecting them together.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharide looked like a tiny sugar duo, dancing happily in the solution.

meanings.definition: A type of carbohydrate consisting of two sugar molecules linked together.
meanings.sent1: The disaccharide in my energy bar provides a quick source of fuel for my workout.
meanings.sent2: When I eat bread, my body breaks down the disaccharide into simpler sugars for energy.
meanings.sent3: Why did the disaccharide bring a friend to the party? To have a sweet duo on the dance floor!
meanings.sent4: The disaccharide acted like a tiny sugar chain, holding the two sugar molecules together.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharide was like a sugary handshake between the two sugar molecules.

meanings.sent1: The disaccharide molecule is made up of two sugar units bonded together.
meanings.sent2: In my biology class, we studied the structure of a disaccharide under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: Why did the disaccharide go to school? To get a double degree in sweetness!
meanings.sent4: The disaccharide was like a tiny sugar pair, always sticking together.
meanings.sent5: The disaccharide molecule looked like a sweet couple, inseparable in the solution.
